poem:
**Medicinal Garden**

In the paper:  
heritage, tradition—  
soft words, like poultice  
laid on a bruise.

But medicine is one thing:  
trial, pulse,  
the measured leaf.

A plant may enter  
by the gate of tai chi,  
yoga, bark, root—  
only when it proves  
it will not poison  
the hand that gathers it.
